alert.note: Alert for Harlan; Leslie; Letcher; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 3:10AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Harlan, southwestern Letcher, southeastern Leslie and southeastern Perry Counties through 345 AM EDT... At 309 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Big Fork, or 11 miles southeast of Hyden, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Big Laurel around 315 AM EDT. Arthur and Leatherwood around 320 AM EDT. Pine Mountain and Slemp around 325 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Gilley, Delphia, Nolansburg, Totz, Highsplint, Shields, Hiram, Diane, Gordon, Louellen, Black Bottom, Lejunior and Defeated Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
